item.title: Shooting at Texas Mall Leaves at Least Eight People Dead
item.description: Seven others were injured in the rampage at the Allen Premium Outlets outside of Dallas. Authorities said the suspect was “neutralized.”

item.description: The houses must be white. There are even specific rules about the dinnerware. Everybody still wants in.

item.title: Mage Wins the Kentucky Derby Amid String of Horse Deaths at Churchill Downs
item.description: The 15-1 winner overtook Two Phil’s in the middle of the stretch in a year when the circumstances surrounding the race loomed over the biggest day in U.S. racing.

item.description: He&#x27;s a 70-year-old tycoon with a taste for risky ventures some rivals wouldn&#x27;t dare touch. And this time, he&#x27;s doubling down.

item.title: Warren Buffett Retains Sense of Optimism at Berkshire's Annual Meeting
item.description: The legendary investor confirms he won’t bid for Occidental Petroleum and praises Apple.

item.title: What Investors Should Know About Money-Market Funds and CDs
item.description: Investors are turning to these cash-equivalent investments, some of which are yielding 5% or more. But it pays to have a strategy beyond fear.

item.title: Royal Fashion From King Charles's Big Day
item.description: All the royal and celebrity style at the coronation of King Charles III, from the Princess of Wales to Katy Perry, Lionel Richie, Jill Biden and beyond.

item.title: King Charles III Is Crowned in Lavish Coronation Ceremony
item.description: The coronation marked the new Carolean era with a star-studded guest list, thousands of marching soldiers and a ceremony that celebrates a millennium of history and reflects a more modern, diverse Britain.

item.title: Youngest Shareholders Vie for Chance to Quiz Warren Buffett
item.description: At least one child is usually selected to ask the storied investor a question during the annual meeting.

item.title: Prominent Russian Nationalist Zakhar Prilepin Wounded in Car Explosion
item.description: Authorities in Moscow blame Ukraine as a third vocal war supporter is targeted since the Russian invasion.

item.title: Russia Evacuates Civilians From Parts of Ukraine Ahead of Kyiv Counteroffensive
item.description: The evacuations are the latest step Russian officials have taken to consolidate their hold on occupied parts of Ukraine ahead of an expected Ukrainian offensive to retake lost territory.

item.title: Prison vs. Harvard: The Debate Rematch
item.description: The Bard Prison Initiative team has built an impressive record—and international reputation—since its unlikely 2015 victory.

item.title: World's Top AI Researchers Debate the Technology's Next Steps
item.description: After ChatGPT sparked a frenzy among tech companies, a conference in Africa is focusing on AI’s promise and peril for poorer nations.

item.title: Elon Musk's Goal for Twitter: 'Unregretted User-Minutes'
item.description: Six months into running the social-media company, the billionaire is talking about his own metric of success.

item.title: Kentucky Derby Favorite Forte Is Scratched as Caution Prevails at Churchill Downs
item.description: The move comes in the aftermath of four recent horse fatalities at the track ahead of the Run for the Roses on Saturday.

item.title: A Soldier's View of the Battlefields and Trenches of Bakhmut
item.description: Video captured from Ukrainian troops’ helmets depict the intense attacks and daily moments of tragedy and victory in scenes that recall World War I.

item.title: Driving This Thing, She Always Takes the Long Way
item.description: Elizabeth Weinberg’s 1974 Volkswagen Thing has introduced her to “non-freeway” Los Angeles.

item.title: Who Pays for King Charles III? The Answer Is Changing
item.description: The Crown Estate, which finances the British monarchy, used to be a property company. Awkwardly, it is becoming a national renewable-energy champion.
